meanings.definition: To attack or surprise someone by hiding and waiting for them
meanings.sent1: The lion was ambushing its prey in the tall grass.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were ambushing the enemy troops from behind the trees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoyed ambushing its owner when she least expected it.
meanings.sent4: The comedian was ambushing the audience with unexpected jokes throughout the show.
meanings.sent5: The ninja's skill in ambushing made him a feared warrior on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: An act of lying in wait to attack or surprise someone
meanings.sent1: The ambush was a successful ambushing of the unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent2: The police set up an ambushing to catch the criminals in the act.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party turned into an ambushing of the birthday girl when she walked in.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm felt like an ambushing of the picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: The ambushing of the paparazzi by the celebrity's security team was swift and effective.
